website_summaries.verdict: Having to give up the pizza you knew and loved isn’t as bad as you’d think, especially with this encouraging gluten-free cookbook’s sunny outlook.
pros: A funny, yet uplifting introduction to living with celiac disease and eating gluten-free
Examples include Italian meatloaf, hazelnut chocolate cake, and peanut butter cup cookies

customer_reviews.title: This book helped SO much that i bought it for a friend who was diagnosed like me. Wow - recipes are really great and ...
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY - Someone gets it! IT's AWFUL to HAVE to be GF. It's not a "choice" and it's a very tough thing to adjust to, knowing you can't quit if it gets tough. This book helped SO much that i bought it for a friend who was diagnosed like me. Wow - recipes are really great and just the banter and wording felt a little empowering. Thank you! GF IS my bitch now!
customer_reviews.author: A. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: She enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.text: I Gave this to my cousin as a christmas gift. She enjoyed it.This hilarious book was a wonderful guide for not only the gluten-free. Celiac and gluten sensitivity runs in my family, and I have several gluten-free friends, I bake gluten free. I was even offered a job at a gluten free bakery but I had to deny but the pay was to low.. The book is a great resource to learn how to substitute items.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M.

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this “New” & the cover is dirty
customer_reviews.text: Item doesn’t appear to look like it’s been read. Unsure if it is truly new but had been sitting in a dirty box for a long time or what. Not satisfied as I had to try and clean the white paper cover over the hardcover book with a paper towel and some water/windex to get the dirt appearance off. Looks a little better now but still dirty. Annoyed since it is a Christmas gift for someone who is recently gluten free. Besides that It looks used I hope she will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Rica

customer_reviews.title: Great book! Shes so funny, read it too!
customer_reviews.text: Love this book! She's not only funny but the recipes are great. You actually feel better about yourself reading her take on gluten free so make sure you read it, not just flip to recipes
customer_reviews.author: Lisa/joe

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! The author voiced everything I have been thinking since I was diagnosed with celiac disease! She made fun a sucky situation and still made you realize how important it is to eat right and take care of yourself. I am forever changed by reading this! I have recommended this to anyone and everyone I come across that has issues with gluten.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Sigler

customer_reviews.title: Funny and relatable
customer_reviews.text: Funny and relatable! When my doctor told me to go gluten-free because of thyroid issues, I looked at her like she was nuts. Then I hopped onto amazon and looked up books. As soon as I saw this title, I knew this would be the book for me. Going gluten-free is not easy, but then again, neither are the consequences of eating gluten and the author does not sugar-coat anything. I kind of wish she was my friend because this book really helped me deal with being GF.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Hatton

customer_reviews.title: Informative and easy read because it's funny
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all pretty much. I learned a lot and laughed out loud a few times. Not all celiac's are the same, some have no outward symptoms, while she can't even touch a bagel without getting sick so you may need more info.. but her story will resonate with most dealing with celiac and she's included a lot of advice and quite a few recipes.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: I love April's open and honest responses to having to go ...
customer_reviews.text: I love April's open and honest responses to having to go gluten free. Her stories and advice are priceless! She shares recipes and anecdotes all while speaking to us in clear and straightforward passages that let you know you are not alone in the bewildering gluten-filled jungle. If you are looking for real advice from the trenches, told in down-to-earth fashion, then this is the book for you!
customer_reviews.author: Ligeia

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious, easy to read and tells you how it is
customer_reviews.text: As a recently diagnosed celiac this book took me through the rollercoaster of emotions I was feeling! Such a good read for anyone with celiac, a gluten allergy or for anyone who has someone they love that is gluten free. I can't wait to try the recipes!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Letellier

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a good book and shopping was fast. However, I bought this as “new” and it looks used. There’s dents, marks and a dog ear flap on one of the pages. Kinda hard to wrap this up and give as a gift to someone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Double gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother as did someone else. I’m very disappointed that I have to pay $5.99 to return this. I’ve realized many businesses mislead prime customers. If you were a prime item I wouldn’t have to pay for any return.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gluten free /celiac resource
customer_reviews.text: Peveteaux is witty and informative. She speaks her mind and is honest about her feelings and experiences. This is an excellent resource for the new Celiac like me, diagnosed 1/6/15. Many thanks to April and those like her who are not afraid to tell us newbies like it is and not sugar coat the message. BRAVO job well done!
customer_reviews.author: Reggie and TracyTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: It was an easy read, and I enjoyed reading it
customer_reviews.text: The first book I got when I found out I had celiac disease. It was an easy read, and I enjoyed reading it.
customer_reviews.author: Christy from Montana

customer_reviews.title: Good book, great gift! Easy to follow recipes.
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a great gift! The recipes in it are useful and were made on multiple occasions, they are enjoyable and they are relatively easy to understand and make!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle H

customer_reviews.title: This is a good book!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my friend whose grandson has celiacs disease. She had to learn how to cook all over again.... without gluten. She loved it and uses it every time her grandson visits.
customer_reviews.author: 1puppy & a headache

customer_reviews.title: As one of the 'afflicted' aka the Gluten-Free I had to get this book
customer_reviews.text: I gave it as a gift to my mom for Mother's Day. She is also gluten-free (GF) and kind of a pioneer in GF baking; though the irreverence of this book was definitely pushing the envelope in our mother/son gift-giving relationship, she ended up loving it.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Franceschi

customer_reviews.title: If you're GF, you want this book
customer_reviews.text: Yep! Being gluten free is very trending these days. But for those of us who aren't being gluten free just to be trendy and impress our friends... Fellow Glutards take note: This is a funny, enjoyable book detailing the challenges of having a gluten "issue". Nice to know there are actually others having the same issues. You'll like this book.
customer_reviews.author: Kraig

customer_reviews.title: Must read!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 18 yr old daughter who was newly diagnosed with Celiac. A MUST READ for anyone who has Celiac or is a caregiver, as it's full of humor and tips for living with this disease (who knew that gluten free food is a tax write off!) oh and great recipes too!
customer_reviews.author: Alicat

customer_reviews.title: Good Gift Choice!
customer_reviews.text: I found this for my sassy good friend Lisa who is an outstanding cook and who is celiac. She found the title hilarious and was excited to try some new recipes!
customer_reviews.author: CeeCee Clark

customer_reviews.title: Funny and full of good recipes
customer_reviews.text: This book was written in a humorous and lighthearted style about a potentially deadly condition. As someone who has had her share of restaurant incidents, I was nodding my head and laughing in agreement all the way through. There are some great recipes here that I'm looking forward to trying!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Perreault

customer_reviews.title: Good gift!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my step dad who has celiacs he thought it was hilarious!
customer_reviews.author: Talia

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I bought this for a friend with ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I bought this for a friend with Celiac's disease and it made her year! She likes the humor, rawness and recipes.
customer_reviews.author: A.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: If you are gluten intolerant or suffer from celiac disease, this is the book for you. It is humorous yet it addresses the seriousness of the disease's. In addition it provides some wonderful advice and recipe's. For a recently diagnosed this book is a must have to start on the road of change. I have purchased a copy of this for three others recently.
customer_reviews.author: Average Worker

customer_reviews.title: I adore this book!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to gluten free and struggling so glad I found her books this is the perfect place to start her honest down to earth style is awesome count recommend it more highly
customer_reviews.author: Zenobia

customer_reviews.title: Funny and informative
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my niece. Very informative for anyone with a gluten allergy. Easy reading. The author is hilarious.
customer_reviews.author: mary kepp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and follow. Love all of the humor!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and follow. Love all of the humor!
customer_reviews.author: Joy Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: This book is great. Good information, comical approach, very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Jen K

customer_reviews.title: She loved the attitude of the book and the recipes
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my mom who has recently been fighting her gluten allergy. When she opened it for Christmas, she burst out laughing. She loved the attitude of the book and the recipes. Great!
customer_reviews.author: Allison S.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT READING FOR ANYONE HAVING CELIAC !
customer_reviews.text: THIS AUTHOR WHO ALSO HAS CELIAC TELLS YOU RIGHT UP FRONT WHAT SHE THINKS OF THIS TERRIBLE DISEASE !!!
customer_reviews.author: Maureen B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Prefect book to match what people really think! And feel thank u for the realization of life
customer_reviews.author: BRANDY

customer_reviews.title: Gluten Free
customer_reviews.text: I gave this book to my niece who is always complaining that she has to eat only gluten free food. She called to tell me that the book hit everyone of her complaints & made her laugh at herself. She tried the recipes & liked it. Now she's giving this book out to friends who also have gluten free diets.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta

customer_reviews.title: Great read for those of uf transitioning to GF
customer_reviews.text: I loved this book, exactly what I needed to read with recently being voluntold to go Gluten Free.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good information and recipes
customer_reviews.text: Got this book as a gift for my sister in law and she loves it. It tells you more about other possible symptoms and the author is rather funny. I looked at some of the recipes and they seem pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Gave this to my daughter for Christmas... ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my daughter for Christmas. ... Absolutely loves the book. If you are looking for a GFBook with recipes and a flat out tell it how it is or was before going GF... This is the book
customer_reviews.author: Deb H.

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Great info for someone just diagnosed with Celiac disease (allergy to gluten, found in barley, rye and wheat.) Also great for a parent of a new celiac patient.
customer_reviews.author: Sue of Kalamazoo

customer_reviews.title: Like sitting with an old friend
customer_reviews.text: Someone finally understands gluten! This woman is my new best friend yet I feel like I've known her for years. At times I can't stop laughing and others I cant stop crying. She totally knows what I feel like living with celiac. Wish I could hug her1
customer_reviews.author: oh-so-busy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend (from a NCGS)
customer_reviews.text: Love this book. So informative and useful, and enjoyable to read!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Book
customer_reviews.text: Hysterical. Love this book. I can't tell you how many times I laughed out loud. Loads of good info. for Celiacs and gluten intolerant Individuals.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sent it to a friend for her birthday and she really loves it! Recipes and jokes, can’t beat it!
customer_reviews.author: LeAnna Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: I recently found out that I have Celiacs. This ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently found out that I have Celiacs. This book had so much information and really helped me understand about Gluten. It has a little bit of everything you need to know. Recipe's shopping and restaurant information. Definetly a book to read
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A Bulson

customer_reviews.title: friend loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my friend and she totally loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Funk

customer_reviews.title: The author is honest and hysterically funny. Lots of good info throughout the entire book
customer_reviews.text: What a treat this book was for my daughter. She laughed and cried. She said it was the first honest book she has read about gluten. The author is honest and hysterically funny. Lots of good info throughout the entire book. A must if you are celiac.
customer_reviews.author: NKAWTG

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious and relatable!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for a gluten intolerant friend and she thought it was hilarious and very relatable. She found recipes for foods she never thought she'd be able to eat ever again!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Funny title but good book
customer_reviews.text: Cute and funny. I can't wait to try some of these recipes. I had it laying on the kitchen table and when my mom came over to visit she saw the book and actually had to do a double take
customer_reviews.author: Amy Elkins

customer_reviews.title: Catchy title. Looking forward to finishing this book
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t read all of his book. I have Celiac disease so the title of the book was catchy and truthful !!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Wood

customer_reviews.title: So helpful
customer_reviews.text: I am newly diagnosed with Celiacs and this book was a breath of fresh air! Great advice from every aspect of the autoimmune disorder and how to cope with it daily
customer_reviews.author: Madicakes23

customer_reviews.title: Love this book great recipes and laughter for my daughter ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this book great recipes and laughter for my daughter who is celiacs. Also many informative things for her to read.
customer_reviews.author: heather cooper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my daughter and she said she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Tanton

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic book! I read from cover to cover the ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic book! I read from cover to cover the first day I got it. Foods delicious! A good sense of GF humor thrown in also.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Newhouse

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS BOOK!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, I was skeptical when I bought this book. I have been gluten free for over 3 years now, and I didn't think I had muchleft to learn. I learned a few new tricks and laughed my way through this book. I highly recommend this book to anyone new or experienced to having to live Gluten Free.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious and Informative
customer_reviews.text: This book is both hilarious and informative. The recipes are delicious. I was just diagnosed with celiac and this book has really helped me come to terms with the entire lifestyle change.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: its working great so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife to add a book with bitch in big letters to our library, its working great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Just love this book!
customer_reviews.text: OMG love this book!! I got it for my boyfriend. We were cracking up and loved the recipes! I also like the kugel recipe!! It's already frustrating having to deal with being Gluten free.. This makes it all the more easier!
customer_reviews.author: Judi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The gift recipient absolutely enjoyed this book! Very informative and even funnier!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the read
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I opened this book to start reading it, I was hooked. It's witty, funny and well written. As someone who recently developed a gluten intolerance, this book was everything I needed to help me navigate this new life syle and laugh at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Waldron

customer_reviews.title: ... decent recipes in the book but I've seen much better.
customer_reviews.text: There were some decent recipes in the book but I've seen much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great read. Can it say enough good about this book.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: This book stands out amongst other celiac tales
customer_reviews.text: Reading Gluten Is My B felt like you met someone at a party that instantly became your best friend while giving you all the details on everyone’s secrets. Sometimes that is exactly what you need when thrown into a new situation.
customer_reviews.author: EK731

customer_reviews.title: Educational for the g-free and friends of g-free!
customer_reviews.text: I laughed, I cried...and I'm just glad I didn't poop my pants (like the author)! Though filled with laughs on every page, the book is incredibly informative.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Matloff

customer_reviews.title: Must read for celiac and other G-Fs
customer_reviews.text: Most honest and humorous book on the subject, with great recipes, dining out suggestions and even upcoming medical assistance from someone who obviously speaks from personal (and disgusting) experience.
customer_reviews.author: JS1

customer_reviews.title: Ahhh.... Can't stop laughing....
customer_reviews.text: This book provides the best way to look at the limitations of having to be gluten free, with a sense of humor... It's the only way you will get through it, especially if you are a true Celiac. Loved every paragraph, worth every penny ;-)
customer_reviews.author: sirfreedom

customer_reviews.title: I agree with the title
customer_reviews.text: I thought this book would be funnier than it was. Sorta lost interest. But had some good moments too, that I could relate to.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hilarious just what I needed when I first got diagnosed with celiac. It lifted my spirits and made me laugh. Great delicious recipes in the book as well!
customer_reviews.author: V. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: A birthday gift for my mother. She has arthritis in her spine that becomes problematic when gluten is involved. Although it is quite s bit of work to stay gluten free, this book has added some fun into the equation. Thanks to April Peveteaux for her awesome sense of humor!
customer_reviews.author: Alienbaby

customer_reviews.title: Funny and good suggestions for gluten free foods to make or buy
customer_reviews.text: Like the recommendations for "best" products in gluten-free product lines. Some gluten-free items are pretty awful and saves me the trouble and $$ of weeding out the bad for the good
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternatives!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cook book with many differnt recipes and alternatives for gluten!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: pretty funny when I needed to laugh at the annoyances that come with having Celiac's Disease.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is that bad, has helped motivate me to quit
customer_reviews.text: First time someone bitched out being gluten free as much as I've wanted to. I felt heard, I felt I was not alone. At some point, I want to find out if I have celiac's or just gluten intolerance, and thought that knowing that would be the motivator to go gluten free. No, this book has really helped, actually. The awful things she describes have happened to me, and the fact that yes, it is that bad, has helped motivate me to quit. Thanks, April =)
customer_reviews.author: bearpaw7

customer_reviews.title: Great Book!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book. Funny tidbits throughout and great recipes. Thank you April. I'm waiting for your next book to come out.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Might As Well Laugh
customer_reviews.text: I found April's blog while looking for info. about living gluten-free. I loved her ability to make me laugh while also learning about what a gluten-free life is all about. I love this book and am happy to recommend it for the same reasons I love her blog. This is a great read for all people with a need to be sans gluten and anyone who wants to spend time with them!
customer_reviews.author: Janel A. Luna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: True to life and frustration comes out biting yet funny. Helpful
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift but they say they loved it!
customer_reviews.author: AMP

customer_reviews.title: Best book on the subject
customer_reviews.text: Best book on the subject. Total honesty and actual suggestions. None of that "I choose not to eat that" instead of "I can't eat that" crap. I'm working on owning celiac but I don't have to like it. Not tried the recipes but they look good. I just don't really cook.
customer_reviews.author: raychull

customer_reviews.title: Loved this book
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this book as my daughter was diagnosed at age 32 with Celiac disease. We both purchased it & have totally enjoyed the candid advice and hilarious take on the gluten-free lifestyle. Many helpful suggestions as well as a lot of information tucked into an entertaining book.
customer_reviews.author: audfromlowell

customer_reviews.title: Its funny and has some great advise if you're just starting ...
customer_reviews.text: Its funny and has some great advise if you're just starting out with the gluten free lifestyle but I wish it had more recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Katia

customer_reviews.title: Funny but uses dairy in many recipes
customer_reviews.text: This book was really the dose of funny I was looking for. It is refreshing. My only concern is that the majority of the recipes use dairy. Many people who cannot eat gluten also cannot eat dairy. I would not recommend it for the recipes for someone who is dairy free.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great book for people changing their diet with Gallbladder problems or Gluten allergies.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Lietuvnikas

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely loved this book
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this book. It was informative and entertaining at the same time. This is a must read.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley hart

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: This book was great. Not only did it have recipes but it was a book that talked about being gluten free. Came in perfect shape also.
customer_reviews.author: Laura W.

customer_reviews.title: Really well written
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend has celiac disease and I got this as a gift for her. She loves it
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Humorous, Insightful and Mega-Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: The resources and recipes are wonderful. This book can reach true celiacs and those struggling with gluten sensitivities. It's also great for beginners or veterans.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Traylor Burford

customer_reviews.title: Great read for any celiacs disease sufferers!
customer_reviews.text: The author perfectly describes the feelings of celiac sufferers starting with the diagnosis to the major changes need to be made in our lives.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Great for Celiacs!
customer_reviews.text: Great book, would recommend for everyone struggling with celiac disease!
customer_reviews.author: Night Shift

customer_reviews.title: Lots of info
customer_reviews.text: Great recipes and stories that help me know I am not alone with this disease. Definitely a good book for celiacs or gluten sensitive people.
customer_reviews.author: Sue-Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Great if you are or are trying to be gluten free
customer_reviews.text: Being gluten free is hard This book actually had me laughing about it as author definitely gets it Also has good recipes
customer_reviews.author: pomeranians

customer_reviews.title: but I was pleased when I found out that it was well received
customer_reviews.text: this was a gift. but I was pleased when I found out that it was well received.
customer_reviews.author: chief

customer_reviews.title: This book made me LOL - awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome book full of great recipes. The author is very funny and writes on a personal level that makes you feel like your talking to a close friend instead of a book author. Made me laugh and gave me plenty of "Ah-ha" moments as well as plenty of "So I'm not alone" confirmations. Would recommend to anyone with gluten issues.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: A Great Help in Learning How to Cope with Celiac Disease
customer_reviews.text: As uplifting an approach to a daunting issue as one is likely to find. If you're the sort of person who prefers laughing to crying, this book should appeal to you.
customer_reviews.author: Un-indicted Co-conspirator

customer_reviews.title: Great book packed with recipes and info.
customer_reviews.text: Great book packed with recipes and info. Would recommend to everyone who is looking to cook Gluten-Free.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy D.

customer_reviews.title: Celiac rejoice
customer_reviews.text: Rejoice celiac peeps!!! This book is for real. From the moment I started reading this book, I didn't want it to end. I felt like it was everything I have ever went through and more. This book is a must read for anyone newly diagnosed with celiac disease, and/or parents of celiac kids. An amazing resource.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love the book. It's a great read. Good recipes and lots of comedic relief. This is especially refreshing when charged with such an arduous task as going gluten free in this gluten-saturated market.
customer_reviews.author: b-Lin

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my dad and he loves it; He loves the authors sense of humor and can relate to scenarios in the book because he has celiac’s disease. He’s hasn’t set down since Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: An irreverent look at gluten, this book helped my adult daughter bake again.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Mac

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well executed and hilarious to. Helped more than most books on the market
customer_reviews.author: janetpettersen

customer_reviews.title: Funny look at Gluten
customer_reviews.text: If you have to suffer through life seeking out Gluten Free foods, you know what a hassle it is. This book helps you laugh at the issue so you don't get so frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: ... FOR MY FRIEND AND HE SAID IT WAS BOTH FUNNY AND HAD SOME GOOD RECIPES
customer_reviews.text: IT WAS A GIFT FOR MY FRIEND AND HE SAID IT WAS BOTH FUNNY AND HAD SOME GOOD RECIPES.
customer_reviews.author: BUZZ

customer_reviews.title: Laugh at Celiac Disease!
customer_reviews.text: I loved reading a book that took seriously the subject of celiac disease, but also made me laugh out loud. I could really identify with the author. Fun reading.
customer_reviews.author: Ladyslipper

customer_reviews.title: Thanks April!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good book for persons like me who were reluctantly thrust into this gluten free world which is about as much fun as root canal without novocaine. Funny and informative for all stages of the gluten intolerant and celiac. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Great book! Very funny, and useful!
customer_reviews.text: My boss loved the book! I got it for her for her birthday. It is so funny, and she can't stop raving about it! She said it had plenty of useful tips!
customer_reviews.author: Le Magicien.

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Such a good read for all things ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Such a good read for all things gluten. Haven't tried the recipes yet but the book is great.
customer_reviews.author: King
